summary.long: 2 Thessalonians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: From Paul and Silvanus and Timothy, to the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Grace and peace to you from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We ought to thank God always for you, brothers and sisters, and rightly so, because your faith flourishes more and more and the love of each one of you all for one another is ever greater.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a result we ourselves boast about you in the churches of God for your perseverance and faith in all the persecutions and afflictions you are enduring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is evidence of God’s righteous judgment, to make you worthy of the kingdom of God, for which in fact you are suffering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is right for God to repay with affliction those who afflict you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and to you who are being afflicted to give rest together with us when the Lord Jesus is revealed from heaven with his mighty angels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With flaming fire he will mete out punishment on those who do not know God and do not obey the gospel of our Lord Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will undergo the penalty of eternal destruction, away from the presence of the Lord and from the glory of his strength,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: when he comes to be glorified among his saints and admired on that day among all who have believed—and you did in fact believe our testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in this regard we pray for you always, that our God will make you worthy of his calling and fulfill by his power your every desire for goodness and every work of faith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in you, and you in him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now regarding the arrival of our Lord Jesus Christ and our being gathered to be with him, we ask you, brothers and sisters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not to be easily shaken from your composure or disturbed by any kind of spirit or message or letter allegedly from us, to the effect that the day of the Lord is already here.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Let no one deceive you in any way. For that day will not arrive until the rebellion comes and the man of lawlessness is revealed, the son of destruction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He opposes and exalts himself above every so-called god or object of worship, and as a result he takes his seat in God’s temple, displaying himself as God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Surely you recall that I used to tell you these things while I was still with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so you know what holds him back, so that he will be revealed in his own time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the hidden power of lawlessness is already at work. However, the one who holds him back will do so until he is taken out of the way,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and then the lawless one will be revealed, whom the Lord will destroy by the breath of his mouth and wipe out by the manifestation of his arrival.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The arrival of the lawless one will be by Satan’s working with all kinds of miracles and signs and false wonders,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and with every kind of evil deception directed against those who are perishing, because they found no place in their hearts for the truth so as to be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Consequently God sends on them a deluding influence so that they will believe what is false.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so all of them who have not believed the truth but have delighted in evil will be condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we ought to thank God always for you, brothers and sisters loved by the Lord, because God chose you from the beginning for salvation through sanctification by the Spirit and faith in the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He called you to this salvation through our gospel, so that you may possess the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, brothers and sisters, stand firm and hold on to the traditions that we taught you, whether by speech or by letter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may our Lord Jesus Christ himself and God our Father, who loved us and by grace gave us eternal comfort and good hope,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: encourage your hearts and strengthen you in every good thing you do or say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, pray for us, brothers and sisters, that the Lord’s message may spread quickly and be honored as in fact it was among you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and that we may be delivered from perverse and evil people. For not all have faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Lord is faithful, and he will strengthen you and protect you from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And we are confident about you in the Lord that you are both doing—and will do—what we are commanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may the Lord direct your hearts toward the love of God and the endurance of Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we command you, brothers and sisters, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, to keep away from any brother who lives an undisciplined life and not according to the tradition they received from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you know yourselves how you must imitate us, because we did not behave without discipline among you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and we did not eat anyone’s food without paying. Instead, in toil and drudgery we worked night and day in order not to burden any of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was not because we do not have that right, but to give ourselves as an example for you to imitate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even when we were with you, we used to give you this command: “If anyone is not willing to work, neither should he eat.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we hear that some among you are living an undisciplined life, not doing their own work but meddling in the work of others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now such people we command and urge in the Lord Jesus Christ to work quietly and so provide their own food to eat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you, brothers and sisters, do not grow weary in doing what is right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone does not obey our message through this letter, take note of him and do not associate closely with him, so that he may be ashamed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet do not regard him as an enemy, but admonish him as a brother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now may the Lord of peace himself give you peace at all times and in every way. The Lord be with you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I, Paul, write this greeting with my own hand, which is how I write in every letter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator
